content: Use the [Over 38 Calculator](https://cbaguide.com/resources/over38calculator/) to do the math for you.

title: Allocation Over Future Seasons
content:
Despite being paid upon the signing of the Contract, the total amount of the [Signing Bonus](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/paymentarrangements/#signingbonus) is prorated over the amount of years contained in the Contract (other than [ETO‚Äôs](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/)) in proportion to the amount of _guaranteed_ Salary each Season.

To the extent all future years are non-guaranteed, the entire Signing Bonus shall apply in the first applicable Salary Cap Year.

title: Signing Bonus Math
content:
Below are the steps to take, particularly if you are dealing with partial non-guaranteed Seasons and require proration of the Signing Bonus. 

It may be easier to see a visual of the step-by-step process by reviewing Example 3 below and clicking the figure that breaks down the math.

**Signing Bonus Math Breakdown**

**Step 1 ‚Äì Use Fractions and Add Numerators**

For each season with guaranteed Salary, turn it into a fraction (x over 100) and add all the numerators together across all seasons (the numerator is the top number on the fraction for the non-math whizzes).

**Step 2 ‚Äì Find Percentage Each Season**

Change the denominator from 100 to the total numerator obtained from step one, then find the decimal/percentage for the new fraction for that Season. This is the prorated amount for each Season.

**Step 3 ‚Äì Multiply Signing Bonus by Percentage**

Multiply the total Signing Bonus by the prorated amount to find how much is applied to each season.

[Click here math breakdown of Example 3 below.](https://cbaguide.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/sbmath.png).

**üèÄ** **Three Examples of Signing Bonus Reallocation**  
**Example 1:** Player signs a 4-Year Contract with a $4 million Signing Bonus, fully guaranteed without Options or ETOs. $1 million will be charged to each Season.  
  
**Example 2:** Player signs a 4-Year Contract with a $4 million Signing Bonus, fully guaranteed with a Team Option. $1,333,333 ($4 million / 3 guaranteed seasons) will be applied to the first 3 seasons, and nothing to the fourth.  
  
**Example 3:** Player signs a 4-Year Contract with a $4 million Signing Bonus with no Options or ETOs. However, the first season is fully guaranteed, the second season is 75% guaranteed, the third season is 50% guaranteed, and the fourth season is 25% guaranteed. The Signing Bonus will be applied as follows: $1.6 million in Year 1; $1.2 million in Year 2; $800,000 in Year 3; $400,000 in Year 4.

title: Trade Bonuses
content:
If a Trade Bonus was triggered when a Player was traded, then the Trade Bonus is added to his Salary.

Visit the [Trade Bonus](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/trades/tradebonus/) page to determine how to calculate Trade Bonuses.

title: One-Year Minimum Contracts
content:
[Minimum Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/) increases based on a Player‚Äôs Years of Service. To deter Teams from signing younger Players to save money and Team Salary, the CBA created a subsidy.

A Player who signs a 1-Year, [Ten-Day](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#tenday) or [Rest-of-Season Contract](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#rest) for the [Minimum Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/), the Player‚Äôs Salary is lowered to the Minimum Salary for a Player with 2 [Years of Service](https://cbaguide.com/definitions/#yos), unless the Player has less than 2 Years of Service, at which point you just apply his applicable Minimum Salary.

The remaining portion of the Player‚Äôs Salary is then reimbursed out of the ‚ÄúLeague-wide benefits fund.‚Äù

**üèÄ** **Nance Jr.‚Äôs Minimum Contract Subsidized**  
In 2025-26, Larry Nance Jr. signed a 1-Yr Minimum Contract with the Cavs. He has 10 Years of Service in the League.  
  
Compensation: $3,634,153 for 10 YOS;  
  
Cap Hit: $2,296,274 for 2 YOS  
  
Nance Jr. will earn $3,634,153, but the Cavs will have a Cap Hit of $2,296,274 added to Team Salary.

Note that when a subsidized Minimum Contract is waived mid-season, the subsidy is removed when calculating his Dead Salary. Visit the [Team Salary](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/teamsalary/#nonguaranteed) page for details.

title: Minimum Exception vs. Minimum Salary Subsidy
content:
Note the different requirements between the subsidy for _1-year_ Minimum Contracts and the _2-year_ [Minimum Exception](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/salarycap/#minimum). Not all Players that fall into the Minimum Exception will have their Salary subsidized to that of a Player with 2 [Years of Services](https://cbaguide.com/definitions/#yos). 

**üèÄ** **Eubanks Signs for Minimum Exception; Salary Not Subsidized**  
Drew Eubanks signed a 2-year contract with Phoenix in the 2023 offseason. They were able to sign him over the Salary Cap using the Minimum Exception. However, because it was a 2-year deal, his Minimum Salary was for his 5 Years of Service ($2,346,614). Had he only signed a 1-year deal, that amount would have been subsidized for Salary, Apron and Tax purposes to a player with 2 years of service ($2,019,706)

title: RFA ‚Äì The ‚ÄúArenas Provision‚Äù
content:
A Player‚Äôs Salary may be adjusted in [Restricted Free Agency](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/rfa/) under what is now known as the **Gilbert Arenas Provision**.

If the [Gilbert Arenas Provision](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/rfa/#arenas) applies to a Restricted Free Agent, then Salary is attributed in the following ways:

1. New Team ‚Äì If the Offering Team (i.e. the Prior Team does not match), then the average of all seasons is applied to the Team‚Äôs Salary Cap across all Seasons.
2. Prior Team ‚Äì If the Player remains on the same Team (i.e. Prior Team Matches Offer Sheet), then you apply each year to the the Team‚Äôs Salary Cap as-is.  
   * Exception ‚Äì If the Prior Team‚Äôs Team Salary and the average of the aggregate Salaries of the Player is under the Salary Cap, the Prior Team can elect to instead apply the average across all seasons.  
         * This election must be made _at the time of Matching_.

title: EIPPA Generally
content:
As part of an [International Buyout](https://cbaguide.com/eligibility/international/), an NBA Team can pay a Non-NBA Team, organization, representative or person for the purpose of securing the right to enter into a Player Contract with a player who is participating in basketball professionally outside of the United States.

The CBA designates a certain amount a Team can pay that will not count as Salary. These designated amounts are the ‚ÄúExcluded International Player Payment Amounts‚Äù or **EIPPA**.

| EIPPA Amounts   |                |
| --------------- | -------------- |
| Salary Cap Year | Payment Amount |
| 2023-24         | $825,000       |
| 2024-25         | $850,000       |
| 2025-26         | $875,000       |
| 2026-27         | $900,000       |
| 2027-28         | $925,000       |
| 2028-29         | $950,000       |
| 2029-30         | $975,000       |

title: EIPPA and Salary
content:
Any amount that exceeds the EIPPA is counted as Player Salary in the form a [Signing Bonus](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/paymentarrangements/#signingbonus).

If the amount does not exceed the EIPPA, then the payment is not considered Salary and therefore not added to Team Salary.

title: Incentive Compensation
content: All [Incentive Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/) other than Unlikely Bonuses is included in Salary.

title: Suspensions
content: Salary that is not paid to a Player due to [suspension](https://cbaguide.com/governance/conduct/) does _not_ reduce the Team‚Äôs Salary in any way.

title: Loans
content:
If a Team provides a [Loan](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/paymentarrangements/#loans) to a Player, the difference between the interest rate of the Loan and the market interest rate shall be considered additional Salary.

Regular Salary

title: Definition
content: **Regular Salar**y is a type of [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/terms/compensation/), defined as [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) minus [Signing Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/paymentarrangements/#signingbonus) and [Incentive Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/).

title: Regular Salary ‚Äì Uses
Definition
content: [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/terms/compensation/) other than any bonuses of any kind.

title: Current vs. Deferred
content:
Base Compensation includes Current Base Compensation (paid in the Salary Cap Year earned) and Deferred Base Compensation (paid at a later date).

Visit the [Deferred Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/paymentarrangements/#deferred) page for additional restriction on terms.

title: Base Compensation ‚Äì Uses
What‚Äôs Included in ‚ÄúIncentive Compensation‚Äù
Incentive Compensation and Salary
content: All types of Incentive Compensation are counted toward [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) other than Unlikely Bonuses.

title: Limitations for All Incentive Compensation
content: Below are limitations applied to all Incentive Compensation types. Note there are additional limitations depending on the type of Incentive Compensation (see below).

title: Amount
content: Incentive Compensation cannot exceed 20% of a Player‚Äôs [Regular Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/regularsalary/) each Season.

title: Percentage Increase/Decrease
content:
The maximum percentage [increase or decrease](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/#increases) is always either 5% or 8%, and it depends on the type of Contract signed by the player.

The maximum percentage permitted will mirror that of his annual [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) (visit the [Contract Limitations](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/#increases) page for more detail).

When calculating the percentage increase/decrease, Incentive Compensation is calculated separately from the Player‚Äôs [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/).

title: Criteria Unchanged
content: The criteria of each bonus must remain unchanged year to year through a Contract.

title: Amendments
content:
### Original Term of Contract

A contract cannot be amended to modify the terms of Incentive Compensation absent a [Renegotiation](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/renegotiations/) or [Extension](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/).

### Renegotiations

If there is a [Renegotiation](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/renegotiations/), the new Contract may include Performance Bonuses even if they were not included in the Original Contract.

### Extensions

[Veteran](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/)[ Extensions](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/) cannot add Incentive Compensation if not included in the Original Contract.

A Rookie Scale Extension can include Incentive Compensation not contained in the Original Contract, but it can only be earned during the Extended term (_see_ Jalen McDaniels example below).

**üèÄ** **McDaniels‚Äô Bonus Not Earned, but Changed to ‚ÄúLikely‚Äù**  
Jaden McDaniels added a Performance Bonus of earning All-Defensive Team when he signed his Rookie Scale Extension in October 2023\. McDaniels achieved All-Defense during the 2023-2024 Season (i.e. before the Extension kicked in in 2024-2025). Therefore, he was not awarded the Bonus. However, the Performance Bonus was then changed from Unlikely to Likely in 2024-2025 and counted toward Team Salary.

title: In-Season Tournament / Play-In Games
content: Any statistics accrued from the In-Season Tournament Finals Game or the Play-In Games are _not_ factored into whether benchmarks are achieved, nor can Performance Bonuses be related to such games.

title: Prohibited Contracts
content: Incentive Compensation is not permitted in [Two-Way Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#twoway) or [Minimum Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/).

title: Performance Bonuses ‚Äì Generally
content: **Performance Bonuses** are a subcategory of Incentive Compensation, so the limitations applied generally to Incentive Compensation (explained above) apply to Performance Bonuses. Performance Bonuses then have their own requirements and limitations, explained below.

title: Requirements
Likely vs. Unlikely Bonuses
content:
### General Determination of Likely or Unlikely

All Performance Bonuses are considered either **Likely** or **Unlikely**, and such determination affects whether the Bonus is included in the Player‚Äôs [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/), and therefore applied to [Team Salary](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/teamsalary/) for [Salary Cap](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/salarycap/) purposes.

A Performance Bonus is deemed Likely if it would have been achieved by the Team or Player in the preceding Salary Cap Year. Otherwise, it is deemed Unlikely.

### Appealing the General Test

If the League or NBPA do not believe this accurately reflects the the nature of the Performance Bonus, they can request a ‚ÄúBasketball Expert‚Äù review the likeliness of the Bonus _at the time of signing the Contract/Extension/Renegotiation_.

The applicable standard for the Basketball Expert depends on the party appealing, who will carry the burden of proof :

1. The League: If it is _more likely than not_ that the bonus will be earned, then it is considered a Likely Bonus.
2. The NBPA: If it is _very likely_ that the bonus will _not_ be earned, then it is considered a Unlikely Bonus.

The Expert‚Äôs ruling is final and unappealable as to how the Performance Bonus is treated.

### What if No Preceding Season?

If there is no applicable preceding season (either the Player did not play or it is an Expansion Team), then the NBPA and League will agree on the likeliness.

If they cannot agree on the likeliness, then the Expert will conduct a hearing, but apply a different standard than a standard appeal: In this situation, the Expert simply determines whether the Bonus is likely to be earned or not likely to be earned.

### Team Salary Pending a Likeliness Determination

While the appeal process takes place, the entire Performance Bonus is included in the Team‚Äôs Team Salary.

### Performance Bonuses and Trades 

When a Player is traded to a new Team and has team-related Performance Bonuses, those bonuses will be reassessed for likeliness based upon the Receiving Team.

**üèÄ** **Dinwiddie‚Äôs Bonuses Switched to Unlikely in Trade**  
During the 2022-23 season, Spencer Dinwiddie was traded from Dallas to Brooklyn. He had Performance Bonuses linked to achieving Round Two and the Conference Finals. Because Dallas had reached that achievement in 2021-2022, they were deemed Likely. Since Brooklyn was eliminated from the First Round of the Playoffs in 2021-2022, the Bonuses switched from Likely to Unlikely and no longer counted toward Team Salary. 

### Performance Bonuses Achieved Prior to Extension

When a Player adds a Performance Bonus as part of an [Extension](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/), but achieves the Performance Bonus during the original term of the Contract that did not include the Bonus, it is not awarded. The achievement will, however, change to Likely if it was originally Unlikely, and count toward [Team Salary](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/teamsalary/).

**üèÄ** **McDaniels‚Äô Bonus Not Earned, but Changed to ‚ÄúLikely‚Äù**  
Jaden McDaniels added a Performance Bonus of earning All-Defensive Team when he signed his Rookie Scale Extension in October 2023\. McDaniels achieved All-Defense during the 2023-2024 Season (i.e. before the Extension kicked in in 2024-2025). Therefore, he was not awarded the Bonus. However, the Performance Bonus was then changed from Unlikely to Likely in 2024-2025 and counted toward Team Salary.

title: Limitations for Unlikely Bonuses
content:
### Amount of Unlikely Bonuses

The CBA adds an additional limitation specifically on the amount of Unlikely Bonuses:

1. Original Contract ‚Äì Unlikely Bonuses cannot exceed 15% of Regular Salary for such Season.
2. [Extension](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/) ‚Äì If the amount of Unlikely Bonuses in the Salary Cap Year in which the Extension is signed exceeds the 15% of the Player‚Äôs Regular Salary for that year, the Extension may provide for up to the same percentage of Unlikely Bonuses in the first year of the extended term.
3. [Renegotiation](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/renegotiations/) ‚Äì Cannot increase Unlikely Bonuses in a Renegotiation if after such Renegotiation the amount of Unlikely Bonuses covered by the renegotiated contract exceeds 15% of the Player‚Äôs Regular Salary.

### Room Requirement for Unlikely Bonuses

Although Unlikely Bonuses are not counted as [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/)‚Äìand therefore don‚Äôt count toward the Salary Cap‚Äìa Contract cannot include Unlikely Bonuses if his Unlikely Bonuses plus his Salary would cause the Team‚Äôs Team Salary to exceed its Room.

When calculating [Team Salary](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/teamsalary/) to determine if there is [Room](https://cbaguide.com/definitions/#room) for a new Unlikely Bonus, you add in all Unlikely Bonuses included for all Players on the roster that might be paid that season.

**üèÄ** **Rule Closes a Loophole Used to Sign Irving and Durant to Brooklyn**  
This rule was put into place to close a loophole. Let‚Äôs say the Nets sign Durant and Kyrie in 2019 after winning 35 games. They could include the benchmark to win 36 games as a Performance Bonus in their contracts, and it would be considered ‚ÄúUnlikely‚Äù (absent an appeal) and therefore not count toward the Salary Cap, giving the Nets more Cap Space to sign players. This forces those Unlikely Bonuses to be included in Team Salary when stacking Unlikely Bonuses in free agency.

title: Requirements for Physical/Academic Achievements
content:
Attendance/participation in off-season skill/conditioning program cannot exceed two weeks.

Must provide incentive for a positive achievement, cannot relate to a negative achievement.

Can be linked to achieving educational degrees or attending programs such as Summer League.

If bonus relates to attendance of certain programs (e.g. Summer League/conditioning programs), the Team must provide sufficient information and allow a reasonable opportunity for Player to attend.

**üèÄ** A more common physical ahicvement incentive is the incentive to attend Summer League and summer conditioning requirements for a Draft Pick signing a Rookie Scale Contract, oftentimes increasing the Rookie Scale Salary to the maximum 120% of the Rookie Scale Salary when achieved.

title: Payment Despite Non-Attendance
Generally
Increase in Protection
content:
Subject to the exception below,the percentage of protected [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) cannot exceed the percentage of unearned protected Base Compensation of any prior Season.

**üèÄ** A team cannot provide 50% Compensation Protection in Season One of the Contract, and 100% of Compensation Protection in Season Two.

Note the additional limitation for [Option Years](#optionchange) discussed below.

### Exception when Based on Conditions

The percentage of protected [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) can exceed a prior Season if (i) the higher level of Compensation Protection is conditional and (ii) the condition cannot be satisfied until the completion of the Prior Season.

See allowable [conditions](#conditions) below.

**üèÄ** **Zion‚Äôs Conditional Maximum Rookie Scale Extension**  
In 2022, the Pelicans signed Zion Williamson to a ‚ÄúMaximum‚Äù Rookie Scale Extension. However, his Compensation Protection throughout the Contract was riddled with conditions. First, Zion‚Äôs remaining three seasons became non-guranteed when Zion missed more than 22 games in the 2022-23 season. He now can earn back guarantees if certain conditions are met, one of them being games played. If Zion plays 41 games, 51 games or 61 games, then his guarantees for the subsequent season increase to 20% at each benchmark. He also has weigh-in checkpoints and roster conditions.

title: Basketball-Related Injury
content: [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) cannot be protected for _both_ a Basketball-Related Injury and Injury/Illness.

title: Types of Conditions Permitted
Termination Prior to Condition
content: If a condition must occur prior to the trigger of any Compensation Protection, then the applicable protection is only effective if the contract is not previously terminated at the time the condition is satisfied.

title: Termination Prior to Exercising of Option
content:
Below are the rules that govern whether Compensation Protection remains in place in an [Option Year](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/) when the Contract is terminated prior to the Option being exercised.

### Team Options

Compensation Protection is only effective when the [Option](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/) is exercised by the Team prior to the termination of the Contract.

### Player Options

The Team and Player will negotiate whether the Protected Compensation in the [Player Option](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/) year remains protected when the Contract is terminated prior to the Player exercising his Option.

The specific language to include in the Contract is contained within the CBA, and is set forth below:

* Remains Protected: ‚ÄúIf this Contract is terminated by Team prior to Player‚Äôs exercise of the Option described in Exhibit 1 of the Contract, then Player shall be entitled to benefit from the Base Compensation protection provisions of this Exhibit 2 to the same extent if the exercise of the Option by Player had occurred prior to Team‚Äôs termination of the Contract.‚Äù
* Protection Extinguished: ‚ÄúIf this Contract is terminated by Team prior to Player‚Äôs exercise of the Option described in Exhibit 1 of the Contract, then Team shall be relieved of any obligation to pay Player any Base Compensation with respect to the Option Year.‚Äù

Note if the Compensation Protection would be extinguished, then the Player cannot exercise his Option until the Team‚Äôs last game of the Season prior to the Option Year.

**üí°** This, of course, is to eliminate the Player‚Äôs ability to exercise his Option well in advance of his Option Year to trigger his guaranteed Salary when he knows the Team is going to waive him.

title: Terms of Protection Must Remain Unchanged
content:
In an [Option Year](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/), the percentage and conditions of Compensation Protection must remain the same from the Prior Year.

**üèÄ** **Harden‚Äôs Extension Works Around the Rule**  
In 2025, James Harden declined his 2025-26 Player Option to sign a new Extension with the Clippers. They wanted to sign a 2-year Extension with guaranteed salary in the first year, but only partially guarantee the second year along with a Player Option. They did this by only guaranteeing 31.4% of Year 1 of Harden‚Äôs Contract, but it became fully guaranteed on July 11, 2025‚Äìjust 5 days after he signed the Contract. Since they did so, they were permitted to then only guarantee 31.4% of his Contract in Year 2 with his Player Option, along with the same July 11th roster condition.

title: Prior Injury Exclusion
content:
The **Prior Injury Exclusion** is a carve out to Compensation Protection, where the right to receive Base Compensation is eliminated when the player‚Äôs disability or unfitness to play skilled basketball is due to the reinjury of a condition that existed prior to the execution of the Contract.

**üèÄ** **Ball Contract Includes Prior Injury Exclusion**  
In 2025, Chicago signed Lonzo Ball to a Veteran Extension after dealing with a significant knee injury throughout his career. The extension included an Exhibit 3 Prior Injury Exclusion to protect the Team against reinjury of his knee.

Note that the Prior Injury Exclusion will not eliminate Compensation Protection for a Season when the Contract is terminated on February 1st or later.

title: Conduct Terminating Protection
The Universal ‚ÄúCutdown‚Äù Date
content:
Any Contract that is terminated for ‚Äúlack of skill‚Äù from January 10th to the end of the Season is entitled to his full [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) for the Season.

Therefore, if a Team seeks to terminate the Contract prior to the Salary being fully guaranteed, the Team must allow the Player to clear [waivers](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/waivers/) prior to January 10th (i.e. he must be cut on January 8th).

title: Waivers and Buyouts
content:
If a Player is waived, he is owed his full Protected Compensation, unless a [Buyout ](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/waivers/#buyout)agreement is reached with the Team, reducing all or a portion of the amount owed.

Visit the [Waivers](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/waivers/) page for details.

title: Payment of Protected Compensation
content:
Visit the [Payment Arrangements](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/paymentarrangements/) page to view the payment schedule when a Team terminates a Contract when Protected Compensation remains owed, often called **Dead Salary**.

**‚úçÔ∏è** Keep in mind this is when payments are made to the Player and has nothing to do with when/how the Compensation Protection affects Team Salary. Visit the Waiver page to review the Team‚Äôs ability to stretch [Dead Salary](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/waivers/#deadsalary).

Payment Arrangements

title: Summary of Payment Arrangements
content:
The [UPC](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/upc/) contains a default **Payment Schedule**, where the Player‚Äôs [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) is paid on semi-monthly installments over each Season.

Subject to limitations, the CBA has tools to allow the Team and Player to agree to different Payment Arrangements to receive his [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) sooner, or defer payments to a later date. Those tools include the following (discussed in more detail below):

1. [Adjust the Payment Schedule](#schedule) ‚Äì Can be paid twice as fast over the Salary Cap year, or extend payments over an 18-month period.
2. [Advances](#advance) ‚Äì Can receive a portion of his current Season‚Äôs salary earlier than the standard monthly payments.
3. [Signing Bonus](#signingbonus) ‚Äì Can receive a portion of his _total Contract_ as soon as it‚Äôs signed.
4. [Deferred Compensation](#deferred) ‚Äì Player can defer his payments to be paid after the Season it‚Äôs earned.
5. [Loans](#loans) ‚Äì Team can lend a Player his guaranteed Salary to be repaid over the term of his Contract.
6. [Premium Reimbursement](#premium) ‚Äì A Team can remiburse a Player‚Äôs premiums paid toward term life insurance.
7. [Dead Salary](#deadsalary) ‚Äì If a Player is waived, then the payment arrangement is altered for the remaining Protected Compensation owed.

title: Effect on Team Salary
content:
_When_ a Player is paid (via the Payment Arrangement), and _how_ [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) is treated as [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) for [Team Salary](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/teamsalary/) purposes, have to be viewed separately.

Below are two examples:

1. [Trade Bonus](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/trades/tradebonus/) ‚Äì The entire amount of a Trade Bonus is _paid_ to the player when traded, but the Trade Bonus is applied as _Salary_ proportionately over the length of the Contract for Team Salary purposes.
2. [Deferred Compensation](#deferred) ‚Äì A Team and Player can agree to Deferred Compensation, meaning a percentage of his Base Compensation earned in the current year is _paid_ at a later date. For Team Salary, the amount is applied to the year he _earns_ the Base Compensation rather than when he is paid.

title: Limitations Generally
content:
No matter what tools the Team and Player want to use to alter the Payment Arrangement, 10% of a Player‚Äôs [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) (excluding [Likely Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/#performance) and [Trade Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/trades/tradebonus/)), _must_ be paid in monthly installments agreed upon via the Payment Schedule below.

**üí°** **The Final Rule to Ensure Arrangement Satisfies the CBA**  
Due to this overarching limitation, when agreeing on payment arrangement terms, one must revisit this limitation and ensure the Player is receiving at least 10% Salary via a regular pay schedule after all Signing Bonuses, Advances, etc. are agreed upon.

title: Default Payment Schedule
content:
The default schedule of payments is 24 equal semi-monthly payments beginning with the first payment on November 1st of each year covered by the Contract.

Payments continue on the 1st and 15th of every month until [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) is paid in full.

title: Payment Schedule Adjustment
content:
### Allowable Terms

Thepay schedule can be amended to 12 or 36 equal semi-monthly payments rather than 24, until the [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) is paid in full.

### Contract Limitations

[Minimum Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/) and [Two-Way Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#twoway) cannot adjust the default payment schedule above.

Note that both these contracts do permit Advances (discussed in more detail below).

title: Advances Generally
content: In addition to adjusting the monthly payment schedule (above), a Player can negotiate receiving a certain amount of his current Season‚Äôs [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) prior to the first payment on November 1st as an **Advance**.

title: Amount of Advance
content:
The amount of an Advance depends on if the Contract is a [Two-Way Contact](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#twoway), [Minimum Contract](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/), or any other [Standard Contract](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#standard).

### Standard Contract (Non-Minimum)

The **Maximum Advance Amount** is the _lesser_ of: 

1. 80% of the Amount of the Player‚Äôs [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) that is protected; or
2. 50% of the Player‚Äôs [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) for such Season.

However, no more than 25% of the Player‚Äôs [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) can be paid prior to the October 1st immediately preceding the first day of the Regular Season.

### Minimum Contracts

If protected for lack of skill and injury/illness, then the **Minimum Player Salary Advance Limit** is the _lesser_ of:

1. 80% of the Player‚Äôs [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) that is protected; or
2. 7.5% of the Player‚Äôs [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) for such Season.

The Advance will be deducted in full from the Player‚Äôs first installment of [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) on November 1st, and then from the second installment if needed.

### Two-Way Contracts

If protected for lack of skill and injury/illness, then the **Two-Way Contract Advance Limit** equals 50% of the amount of the Player‚Äôs [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) the season that is protected.

The Advance shall be deducted in full from the Player‚Äôs first installment of [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) on November 1st, and then from the second installment if needed.

title: Signing Bonuses Generally
content:
### Definition

A **Signing Bonus** allows a Player to be paid a portion of the total [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) in his Contract up front, subject to restrictions.

Note that under the CBA, a [Trade Bonus](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/trades/tradebonus/) and payments in excess of the [EIPPA](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/#eippa) are also defined as Signing Bonuses.

### Signing Bonuses vs. Advances

Note that Signing Bonuses pay a percentage of all [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) due under the entire Contract up front, while Advances pay a percentage of the Player‚Äôs current Season‚Äôs [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) up front.

title: Amount of Signing Bonus
content:
### Original Contract or Extension

Signing Bonus cannot exceed 15% of the [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) (excluding [Incentive Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/)) called for by the Contract.

If it‚Äôs an [Extension](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/), it can‚Äôt exceed 15% of the Extended Term of the Contract.

### Offer Sheets 

No [Offer Sheet](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/rfa/#offersheet) may provide for a Signing Bonus exceeding 10% of [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) (less [Incentive Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/)).

title: Prohibition of Signing Bonus
content:
### Renegotiation 

A [Renegotiated](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/renegotiations/) Contract cannot contain a Signing Bonus _unless_ accompanied by an Extension and would otherwise be permitted under the rules for [Extensions](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/).

### Prohibited Contracts

[Rookie Scale Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/draftpicks/) (other than an [EIPPA](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/#eippa)) and [Two-Way Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#twoway) do not permit Signing Bonuses.

title: Extensions and Signing Bonus
Salary Proration
content:
The Signing Bonus is paid up-front, but is allocated on a pro rata basis over the length of the Contract.

Visit the [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) page for more detail on Salary calculations.

title: Maximum Salary Adjustment
content: _See_ [Maximum Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/) to learn how Signing Bonuses are adjusted when a Player‚Äôs Salary exceeds his applicable Maximum Salary amount.

title: Suspension ‚Äì Return of Signing Bonus
content:
If a Player is [suspended](https://cbaguide.com/governance/conduct/) for an intentional failure/refusal to perform under his Contract, the team is entitled to a return of a portion of the Signing Bonus.

Calculation: The number of games suspended divided by the total number of Regular Season games covered in the Contract (excluding [Option Years](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/)).

title: Sign-and-Trades
content: Any payment made by the Signing Team (i.e. the Team sending the Player) shall be treated as a reimbursement via [cash-in-trade](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/trades/traderules/#cash) of the Receiving Team.

title: Loans Generally
content: A Player and Team can agree that the Team **Loan** the Player money up to the amount he is guaranteed in [Protected Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/) for lack of skill to be repaid over the remaining guaranteed Seasons.

title: Loan Terms
content:
### Amount

No Loan (including any existing loan) can exceed the Player‚Äôs [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) for _then-current Salary Cap Year_ that is protected for lack of skill.

### Repayment

Any loan must be deducted in equal amounts from the Player‚Äôs remaining [Protected Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/) over the length of the contract that is fully protected for lack of skill (not including [Options/ETOs](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/)).

### Loan Reduction

If a loan is made at a time of the Season when the [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) is less than what would be owed on the loan, the maximum loan amount for that Season shall be reduced appropriately. 

### Loan Forgiveness

If a Team forgives any loan, it is considered a [Renegotiation](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/renegotiations/) and such rules will apply.

### Interest Rate/Player Salary

The difference between the interest rate provided in the loan and the **Target Rate** shall be considered as the Player‚Äôs [Salary.](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/)

* Target Rate ‚Äì The   **Prime Rate** plus 1% as of the date the loan is agreed upon, but never lower than 7% and never higher than 9%.  
   * Prime Rate ‚Äì The prime rate reported in the ‚ÄúMoney Rates‚Äù column or any successor column of the _Wall Street Journal_.

title: Limitations on Loans
content:
### Payment Schedule Requirement

The requirement to be paid 10% of the Season‚Äôs [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) in current [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) in accordance with the allowable payment schedule still applies.

### Contract Limitations

[Two-Way Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#twoway), [Rookie Scale Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/draftpicks/), and [Minimum Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/) are all prohibited from including loans.

title: Premium Reimbursements Generally
content: If a Player procures term life insurance for his benefit, the Team may reimburse him each season for the premiums paid.

title: Limitation
content:
### Amount

The amount of coverage for which the premiums are reimbursed cannot exceed the _lesser_ of:

1. Aggregate unearned [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) (excluding [Option Year](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/)); and
2. $85 million less Aggregate unearned Base Compensation (excluding Option) Year _protected for death_.

The reimbursement shall not exceed the cost for 10-year guaranteed term coverage at preferred rates.

### Minimum Contracts

Premium reimbursement is not permitted for [Minimum Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/) that either (i) signed after the Regular Season or (ii) is not fully protected for lack of skill and injury/illness in first season of Contract.

title: Premium Reimbursement and Team Salary
content: The reimbursement of premiums does not count as Salary, and therefore does not contribute toward [Team Salary](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/teamsalary/) against the Salary Cap.

title: Deferred Compensation Generally
content:
### Definition

The Team and Player can agree that Compensation earned in a particular Season is paid after the May 1st of such Season, and is therefore considered **Deferred Compensation** subject to the rules below.

Note that the determination of whether Compensation is defined as ‚Äúdeferred‚Äù is only based upon the terms of the Contract (i.e. when does the Contract say the Compensation is to be paid), and not when the Compensation is actually funded or secured in any fashion.

title: Requirements and Limitations
content:
### Terms

No Contract can provide for Deferred Compensation exceeding 25% of the Player‚Äôs [Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/) for such Season.

All Contracts shall specify the Season to which Deferred Compensation is attributable.

### Salary Calculation

Deferred Compensation shall be included in a Player‚Äôs Salary in the Season it was _earned_, not in the year it was paid.

Visit the [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) page for more details on Salary calculations.

### Contract Limitations

[Two-Way Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#twoway) are prohibited from including Deferred Compensation.

title: The ‚ÄúOver 38‚Äù Rule
content:
The [‚ÄúOver 38‚Äù Rule](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/#over38) is a separate type of Deferred Compensation rule applying to the calculation of a Player‚Äôs Salary.

Visit the [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/#over38) page for more details on when to apply this rule.

title: Dead Salary
content:
If a Contract is terminated and includes [Compensation Protection](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/), then the Compensaiton remains owed to the Player as **Dead Salary**. There is an automatic Payment Schedule for Dead Salary discussed below called the **Mandatory Stretch Provision**.

**‚úçÔ∏è** **Payment of Dead Salary vs. Team Salary**  
Keep in mind this is when payments are made to the Player and has nothing to do with when/how the Compensation Protection affects Team Salary. Visit the [Waiver](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/waivers/#deadsalary) page to review the Team‚Äôs ability to stretch Dead Salary for [Team Salary](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/teamsalary/) purposes.

title: $500k or Less Owed
content:
If $500,000 or less is owed in [Protected Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/), then the Player will be paid in accordance with the Payment Schedule already set forth in the Contract.

Each installment will equal the amount of [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) that was due per pay period for the applicable Season immediately before termination until the aggregate amount due is paid in full.

title: More than $500k Owed
content:
**Current Season Paid per Terms of Contract**

The [Protected Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/) for the current Season (September 1st through June 30th) is paid in the same manner as above.

**Remaining Seasons Paid in Equal Semi-Monthly Installments**

The remaining [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) is paid in equal amounts over the remaining Seasons (including any Player [Option Year](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/)), plus one. If the waiver is made between September 1 and June 30, then the current Season is not included in the number of remaining Seasons. 

The rescheduled payments are then paid in equal semi-monthly installments per the [default payment schedule](#default) in the [UPC](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/upc/).

**üèÄ** **An Example from the CBA**  
  
This example is directly from the CBA:  
  
Player signs a Contract with the following Protected Compensation:  
Year 1 ‚Äì $4 million  
Year 2 ‚Äì $4.3 million  
Year 3 ‚Äì $4.7 million  
Year 4 ‚Äì $5 million  
  
The Player is waived on December 1st of Year 1\. More than $500k is owed. Year 1 is the ‚Äúcurrent season‚Äù and is therefore paid per the terms of the Contract. The remaining $14 million is paid over 7 seasons (twice the remaining seasons, plus one) in equal amounts of $2 million. The payments are then made in semi-monthly installments under the default payment schedule in the UPC.

Options and ETO‚Äôs

title: Options Generally
content:
Options provide a right to extend a Contract. An Option can be a Team Option (allowing the Team to exercise the option and extend the Contract) or a Player Option (vice versa).

Other than [Rookie Scale Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/draftpicks/), which automatically provide two Team Options, the CBA only allows one Option Year in a Standard Contract.

title: Limitations
Exercise Period
content:
Subject to the exceptions below, an Option must be exercised by 5:00 P.M. E.T. on the June 29th prior to the Season the Option covers.

* RFA‚Äôs ‚Äì If (i) it is a Player Option and (ii) the Player would become an RFA if declined, then the Option must be exercised prior to June 25th;
* Rookie Scale Contracts ‚Äì [Rookie Scale Team Options](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/draftpicks/) must be exercised by October 31st the Season _prior_ to the year the Option takes place.

Player Options and Compensation Protection ‚Äì If Compensation Protection would be extinguished if the Contract is terminated, then the Player has to wait until the last game of the Season prior to the Option Year to exercise his Player Option.

title: Options and Compensation Protection
content: To see how Compensation Protection is treated when an Option is declined, visit the [Compensation Protection](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/#option) page.

title: Generally
content: An ETO gives a Player the ability to terminate the Contract early. This is different than an Option, which allows the Team/Player to extend the Contract for another Season.

title: Limitations
content:
The ETO must only shorten the Contract one Year, and must shorten the 4th Season.

If a [Veteran Extension](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/) is signed, the ETO must be eliminated (since it can only terminate the 4th Season).

If an ETO is _exercised_, then the Player is no longer eligible for an [Extension](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/).

If a [Rookie Scale Extension](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/) is signed, an ETO can be added but can only take effect at the end of the 4th season of the extended term of the Contract.

The ETO must be a fixed right and not exercised/declined based upon a condition.

title: ETO Limitation Period
content:
ETO‚Äôs must be exercised by 5:00 P.M. ET on June 29th prior to the Option Year.

Contract Limitations

 The CBA limits Compensation, Contract length and annual increases/decreases in every Contract. The limitations can be due to the Player‚Äôs YOS, the Contract type, or the type of transaction. Below is a breakdown of the minimum and maximum limitations.

title: Minimum Salary Generally
content: The CBA sets Mimimum Salary Players can be paid. The amount is based on their [Years of Service (YOS)](https://cbaguide.com/definitions/#yos) in the League (other than [Two-Way Contracts](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#twoway), which have a set Salary irrespective of YOS).

title: Player‚Äôs Applicable Minimum Salary

title: Payment Arrangements
content:
### Bonuses

Exhibit 1A expressly states there are no bonuses of any kind in a **Minimum Contract**. The exceptions include:

1. [Trade Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/trades/tradebonus/);
2. [Exhibit 10 Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#exhibit10);
3. [EIPPA](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/#eippa) (explained below).

While the EIPPA is a Signing Bonus, it is permitted in a Minimum Contract, provided that the Salary still does not exceed Minimum Salary and the Contract makes clear its yearly allocation for each Season.

### Advances

Permitted if the Minimum Salary is partially or fully protected for lack of skill/injury/illness.

Can be advanced up to the _lesser of_ (i) 80% of the [Compensation Protection](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/) amount or (ii) 7.5% of the Base Compensation.

Advance to be paid prior to November 1st and deducted from the first installment of [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) due (and deducted from future installements if necessary)

### Amending to Minimum Salary

A Contract is automatically amended on July 1st to ensure a Player‚Äôs Salary is not less than the applicable Minimum Salary.

title: Maximum Salary Generally
content:
Regardless of any other rule allowing a Player to sign for a certain amount, the amount will always be adjusted down to his applicable Maximum Salary below.

A Player‚Äôs Maximum Salary depends upon his [YOS](https://cbaguide.com/definitions/#yos) and whether he reached the **Higher Max Criteria**. If he hits the Higher Max Criteria he jumps to the next percentage bracket, often called a ‚ÄúSupermax.‚Äù

_Note that Maximum Salary refers to **Salary plus Unikely Bonuses**_

title: Higher Max Criteria
content:
Below are the conditions that can be met to reach the Higher Max Criteria:

1. The Player either makes All-NBA or is the DPOY in (i) the immediately preceding season or (ii) in 2 of the 3 prior seasons; or
2. Named MVP in 1 of the prior 3 seasons.

**‚úçÔ∏è** **Conditioning New Contract on Higher Max Criteria**  
Note that a Rookie Scale Extension can condition the increase in percentage on hitting the Higher Max Criteria after signing the Extension in the 4th year before the extended term starts. However, the Veteran Extension requires the Higher Max Criteria be reached before the signing of the Extension.

title: Maximum Amount
content:
Below is the Maximum [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) \+ [Unlikely Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/#performance) a Player can receive based upon his YOS.

| 1 to 6 Years of Service |               |                                                                                                                                                    |
| ----------------------- | ------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| StandardMaximum         | HigherMaximum | Criteria for Higher Maximum                                                                                                                        |
| 25%                     | 30%           | Player has 4 YOS; Signing with Prior Team; Higher Max Criteria met through first 4 Seasons                                                         |
| 7 to 9 Years of Service |               |                                                                                                                                                    |
| StandardMaximum         | HigherMaximum | Criteria for Higher Maximum                                                                                                                        |
| 30%                     | 35%           | Player has 8 or 9 YOS; Signing with his first team or with a Team that traded for him in first 4 years; Met Higher Max Criteria at time of signing |
| 10+ Years of Service    |               |                                                                                                                                                    |
| StandardMaximum         | HigherMaximum | Criteria for Higher Maximum                                                                                                                        |
| 35%                     | N/A           | N/A                                                                                                                                                |

title: Amending an Extension with Maximum Salary
content:
Oftentimes a Contract is signed at a time when the Player‚Äôs Maximum Salary in the future is not known, and has to be adjusted.

The Player‚Äôs [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) will be adjusted on July 1st to equal the Maximum Salary. The following categories will be reduced in the following order until the Maximum Salary is reached:

1. [Signing Bonus](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/paymentarrangements/#signingbonus) ‚Äì The Signing Bonus will be reduced first. Signing Bonus for the future seasons is reduced on a pro rata basis.
2. [Incentive Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/) ‚Äì Any Incentive Compensation will be reduced second. Future seasons will be amended to abide by maximum increase/decrease limitations.
3. [Base Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/basecompensation/) ‚Äì Base Compensation will be reduced last. Future seasons will be amended to abide by maximum increase/decrease limitations.

title: Increase and Decrease Limitations
content: After the first year of an Original Contract or the Extended Term, the CBA limits the amount the Compensation can increase or decrease year to year. The limit is either 5% or 8% depending on the transaction type.

title: Percentage Limitation
content:
### Generally

Below are the limitations based upon the Transactions executed:

| Transaction                         | Percentage Limitation |
| ----------------------------------- | --------------------- |
| Full Bird or Early Bird Free Agents | 8%                    |
| All Other Free Agent Signings       | 5%                    |
| Sign-and-Trades                     | 5%                    |
| Extend-and-Trades                   | 5%                    |
| All Other Extensions                | 8%                    |
| Renegotiations                      | 8%                    |
| Maximum Qualifying Offer            | 8%\*                  |
| \*8% raises required                |                       |

The 8% increase/decrease is not available if a Team uses another [Exception](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/salarycap/) to sign a Player even though [Full or Early Bird Rights](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/salarycap/#bird) are available.

**üèÄ** **Team Uses NTMLE to Offer Greater Starting Salary**  
A Team has Early Bird Rights to a Player, but 175% of his Prior Salary is less than his value. The Team therefore uses the NTMLE to sign him to a $14 million starting Salary. Since the Team used the NTMLE, the increase/decrease limitations are 5%, rather than the 8% permitted if Early Bird Rights were used.

### Calculation

The maximum increase/decrease is a fixed amount determined by calculating the percentage of Year 1\. It is _not_ compounded over future years.

**üèÄ** **Bridges Receives 8% Raises in Extension**  
In 2025, Mikal Bridges received a 4-Year, $150 million Extension with the Knicks. His Year 1 Salary was $33,482,145 and he received his maximum raise of 8% ($2,678,571) each Season to reach the $150 million total.

If an [Extension](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/extensions/) is signed stating that Year 1 Salary is based upon a percentage of the Salary Cap, then the annual increase/decrease can also state the percentage rather than a specific dollar amount. The Contract will then be amended to the fixed amount on July 1st of the extended term when the amount is known.

**üèÄ** **Mobley‚Äôs 8% Gets Fixed on July 1st**In 2024, Evan Mobley signed a maximum Rookie Scale Extension with the Cavaliers for 25% of the Salary Cap in Year 1, that increased to 30% if he earned DPOY, which he indeed achieved. The Extension provided for 8% raises each season based upon his Year 1 Salary. On July 1st 2025, his Year 1 Salary was then known to be $46,394,100 and his raise was therefore $3,711,528 each year.

title: Limit Each Compensation Type
Decreases Prohibited in Option Years
content: If there is an [Option Year](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/) in a Contract, the Player‚Äôs [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) (less [Incentive Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/)), [Likely Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/#performance) and [Unlikely Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/#performance) cannot be less than the prior year.

content:

title: No Future Contracts
content: Every Contract must cover at least the then-current (or upcoming Season), and a multi-year Contract cannot skip Seasons.

title: No Decrease in Salary
content:
A Team and Player may not negotiate a decrease in [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) or [Incentive Compensation](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/) covered by an existing Contract.

However, [Compensation Protection](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/) may be reduced (via a Buyout) and an [Option Year](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/options/) can be declined and the Salary can then be reduced in the same Season of the declined Option Year.

Unrestricted Free Agency

**Unrestricted Free Agency (UFA)** is the process upon which a Player is free to sign a Contract with any Team because he is no longer under an existing Contract nor is he subject to Restricted Free Agency or Draft Rights.

title: Finishing a Contract
content: If a Player is in the final Season of his Contract and he is not subject to [Restricted Free Agency](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/rfa/), then he becomes a UFA as of July 1st following his final Season.

title: Other UFA Methods
Signing Dates
content: While a Player becomes a UFA on July 1st, he cannot _sign_ a Contract until after the [July Moratorium](https://cbaguide.com/calendar/).

title: Negotiation Dates
content:
A UFA can negotiate with his Prior Team (if he finished the Season on the Team‚Äôs Roster) after the NBA Finals. 

A UFA can negotiate with any other Team beginning on 6:00 P.M. Eastern on June 30th before he becomes a UFA on July 1st.

title: Team‚Äôs Capable of Signing UFA
Contract Limitations to UFA
content:
A UFA is also limited as to the Contract terms he can sign with any Team. 

Those limitations are contained within the rules for each [Contract Type](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/), as well as general [Contract Limitations](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/) applied universally for Salary, Term Length and increase/decrease limitations.

Restricted Free Agency

**Restricted Free Agency (RFA)** is the process that only some Free Agents with 4 YOS or less are subjected to. The RFA process allows the Player‚Äôs Prior Team to match any other offers the Player signs during the Free Agency process, called an **Offer Sheet**. If his Prior Team matches the Offer Sheet, then he must sign with his Prior Team under the same terms.

title: The RFA Process
content:
**Step 1 ‚Äì Qualifying Offer**

If the Player is subject to Restricted Free Agency, then the Team he last played for (**Prior Team**), has to make a **Qualifying Offer (QO)** to retain its Right of First Refusal (**ROFR** or **Matching**) rights to the Player.

**Step 2 ‚Äì RFA makes a decision**

1. Sign QO: Play under the terms of the 1-Year QO;
2. New Deal with Prior Team: Sign an entirely new agreement with Prior Team;
3. Sign Offer Sheet: Sign an Offer Sheet with another Team (**Offering Team**), giving the Prior Team the right to match.

**Step 3 ‚Äì Prior Team Makes a Decision (only if Offer Sheet signed)**

If RFA signs an Offer Sheet, the Prior Team has to decide whether to Match the Principal Terms of the Offer Sheet or let him sign with the Offering Team.

title: Players Subject to RFA
Qualifying Offers
content: A **Qualifying Offer** (**QO**) is a standard offer the Prior Team has to make to an RFA by the deadline to keep him from becoming an [Unrestricted Free Agent (UFA)](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/ufa/) and losing Matching rights.

title: Key Dates
content:
### Deadline to Trigger RFA

A QO must be made by 5:00 PM on June 29th to trigger the Player‚Äôs RFA Status.

If a QO is not timely made, then the Player will become a [UFA](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/ufa/) instead, removing him from the entire RFA process and allowing him to sign with any Team.

A Team can make a QO anytime after the NBA Finals.

### Deadline to Accept QO

The Player has until October 1st to accept the QO, unless the Team extends the deadline which is permitted through March 1st.

The Team can extend the deadline multiple times, so long as it doesn‚Äôt extend past March 1st.

### Deadline to Withdraw QO

The Team can _unilaterally_ withdraw the QO by July 13th, and can withdraw the QO _with the Player‚Äôs consent_ after July 13th.

The Player immediately becomes a [UFA](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/signings/ufa/) upon withdrawal of the QO.

If the withdrawal occurs after July 13th, then the Team is deemed to have Renounced its Free Agent rights to the Player.

title: QO Terms ‚Äì Standard Contracts
content:
Below are the minimum requirements for QO when the RFA last played on a Standard Contract.

### Salary Requirement

The [Rookie Salary Scale](https://cbaguide.com/resources/rookiescale/) contains the amount of the QO applicable to each Draft Pick.

However, instead of using when the Player was selected, you adjust based on whether the Player meets the **Starter Criteria**. 

See table below for the adjustments based on (i) where the Player was drafted and (ii) if he met the Starter Criteria.

**Starter Criteria**

The Player meets Starter Criteria if he meets one of the following:

1. In his 4th Season, he either (i) started 41+ games, or (ii) played 2,000 minutes; or
2. During his 3rd and 4th Seasons, he _averaged_ (i) starting 41+ games or (ii) 2,000+ minutes played in the Regular Season.

| Starter Criteria Met? | Pick Number          | Salary to Apply                                                                                |
| --------------------- | -------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Yes                   | 1 to 9               | Apply Salary of the Player‚Äôs Draft Pick                                                        |
| Yes                   | 10 to 30             | Apply Salary of 9th Pick                                                                       |
| Yes                   | 31 to 60;Undrafted\* | Apply Salary of 21st Pick                                                                      |
| No                    | 1 to 14              | Apply Salary of 15th Pick                                                                      |
| No                    | 15 to 30             | Apply Salary of the Player‚Äôs Draft Pick                                                        |
| No                    | 31 to 60;Undrafted   | Greater of: 135% Prior Salary/Performance Bonuses; and Minimum Salary (Current Season) + $200k |

\*A Second Round Pick or Undrafted Player must have 2 or 3 YOS to apply 21st Pick Salary 

Steps to Find the Amount of the QO:

**Step 1 ‚Äì Find Applicable Salary Based on Starter Criteria**  
Determine based on the Player‚Äôs draft position and whether he meets the Starter Criteria, which 3rd Year Salary to use for the RFA (use table above).

**Step 2 ‚Äì Apply percentage raise for the 4th Year Salary**  
For the Pick Number applied, increase 3rd year salary with the applicable percentage for the 4th Year Option using the Rookie Salary Scale for his Draft Year.

**Step 3 ‚Äì Apply Applicable Raise**  
For picks 1 through 30, increase the Year 4 Salary by 20%.  
For picks 31 through 60 (and undrafted), keep Year 4 Salary as-is.

**Step 4 ‚Äì Apply the applicable QO Increase**  
Take the number from Step 3 and increase the amount by the applicable QO percentage in the Rookie Scale. This is your QO Amount.

### Other Required Terms

Below are the additional requirements that a QO must contain: 

1. Length ‚Äì Must be for 1 Year;
2. Protection ‚Äì Full [Compensation Protection](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/) for lack of skill/injury/illness;
3. Payment Arrangement ‚Äì Must be [default payment schedule](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/paymentarrangements/#schedule);
4. Physical Exam ‚Äì A [Physical Exam](#rfaexam) contingency is permitted in the QO;
5. Other Terms ‚Äì All other terms must be unchanged from the prior Seasons.

**üèÄ** **Thomas Signs Qualifying Offer**  
In 2025, Cam Thomas signed his 1-Year Qualifying Offer with the Nets after an inability to come to terms on an Offer Sheet with another Team. The Nets offered additional compensation should Thomas waive his inherent No Trade Clause that attached to his Qualifying Offer, but Thomas signed the Qualifying Offer to have control over where he plays next.

title: The Maximum Qualifying Offer
Terms for Two-Way Contracts
content:
Below are the requirements for QO when the RFA last played on a [Two-Way Contract](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#twoway).

### 2-Year Two-Way

If the Player finished a 2-Year Two-Way Contract, or played the last two consecutive Seasons under a Two-Way for the same Team, then the following QO is required:

1. Amount ‚Äì Base Compensation for his applicable [Minimum Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/);
2. Protection ‚Äì [Compensation Protection](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensationprotection/) for lack of skill/injury/illness for $102,000 for the 2025-26 Season, to be increased in line with the Salary Cap.

### All Other Two-Ways

The QO is for the Two-Way Salary amount with the maximum amount of Compensation Protection allowed for Two-Ways.

* Exception ‚Äì If the Player is no longer eligible for a [Two-Way Contract](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/contracttypes/#twoway), then the QO is the same as that for the ‚Äú2-Year Two-Way‚Äù above.

title: Requirements
Offer Sheet Withdrawn
content:
An Offer Sheet can only be withdrawn if consented to by the Player, Offering Team and Prior Team.

If withdrawn, any Team has the ability to sign the Player to another Offer Sheet as if the prior Offer Sheet was never signed.

title: Deficient Offer Sheets
content: If the substance of the QO does not satisfy the requirements above, notice must be provided to the League and the Team will have 5 business days to cure the deficiency without the QO being deemed untimely or insufficient.

title: Principal and Non-Principal Terms
The ‚ÄúArenas‚Äù Provision
content:
The **Arenas Provision** (named after former player Gilbert Arenas) limits the up-front amount of an Offer Sheet when a Player has 1 or 2 YOS. It is meant to give an RFA‚Äôs Prior Team a better chance at resigning the Player when the Prior Team doesn‚Äôt yet have Full Bird Rights to sign the Player over the Salary Cap for as much as he might be worth.

The Arenas Provision will _only_ apply when the RFA has 1 or 2 YOS.

When this is the case, Year 1 of an Offer Sheet is limited to the NTMLE (with adjustments in Year 3 and 4).

Below are the details of the limitation and how it affects Team Salary when applied.

### Salary Limitations/Adjustments

Below is a year-by-year breakdown of the Arenas provision:

**Year 1 Limitation**

The Salary (plus [Unlikely Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/#performance)) in the First Year of the Offer Sheet cannot exceed the amount of the [NTMLE](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/salarycap/#ntmle) for the applicable Year.

**Year 2 Limitation**

The Second Year is limited to a 5% raise from Year 1.

**Year 3 Maximum Adjustment**

If Years 1 and 2 of the Offer Sheet are the maximum provided above, then Year 3 can be _up to_ the [Maximum Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/contractlimitations/) the Player _would have earned_ in Year 3 had he been offered his Maximum Salary since Year 1.

The Offering Team must have [Room](https://cbaguide.com/definitions/#room) in _Year 1 equal to the average aggregate Salaries of all four Years_.

**Year 4 Limitation**

If Year 3 is for the Maximum Salary permitted above, then Year 4 is limited to a 4.5% increase from Year 3.

### Calculating a Maximum Arenas Offer

Below are the steps to calculate a **Maximum Arenas Offer** and how much Cap Space a Team needs to make the offer.

Calculating Maximum Arenas Offer.

**Step 1 ‚Äì Take the Player‚Äôs Maximum Salary.** 

For all Players subject to the Arenas provision, their Maximum Salary is 25% of the Salary Cap. For 2025‚Äì26, this is **$38,661,750**.

**Step 2 ‚Äì Find the Maximum Salary for Year 3.** 

How much _could_ the Player earn in Year 3 if earning a Maximum Salary starting in Year 1 (with 5% maximum raises).

For 2025‚Äì26, this amount is **$42,527,925**.

**Step 3 ‚Äì Break down all yearly amounts of the Maximum Arenas Offer now that we have Year 3.** 

Year 1 ‚Äì $14,104,000 (NTMLE Amount for 2025‚Äì26)

Year 2 ‚Äì $14,809,200 (5% raise from Year 1)

Year 3 ‚Äì $42,527,925 (Maximum Salary for Year 3)

Year 4 ‚Äì $44,441,682 (4.5% raise from Year 3)

The Maximum Arenas Offer is a **4-Year, $115,882,8076 Contract**.

**Step 4 ‚Äì Calculate how much Room the Offering Team needs for the Maximum Arenas Offer.** 

The Room needed by the Offering Team for Year 1 is the average of all four years:

**$28,970,702**

### Calculating Maximum Arenas Offer Based on Cap Space

We know a Team can make the Maximum Arenas Offer above if they have $29 million in Cap Space. But a Team can offer _up to_ this amount.

So what happens if a Team has less than the $29 million in Room? How do we calculate the Maximum Arenas Offer the specific _Team_ can make?

First, Years 1 ($14,104,000) and 2 ($14,809,200) are the fixed maximum amounts that must be made. We also know that Year 4 will be based on a 4.5% raise of Year 3\. The key is taking the Team‚Äôs Cap Space and working backwards to find Year 3.

Calulating Arenas Offer with Team's Cap Space

_**Assume Year 1 Cap Space of $26,000,000**_ 

**Step 1 ‚Äì Turn Cap Space into a 4-year total.** 

$26,000,000 √ó 4 = $104,000,000

**Step 2 ‚Äì Subtract fixed years from the total.** 

$104,000,000 ‚àí $14,104,000 ‚àí $14,809,200 = $75,086,800

(So Years 3 & 4 must total $75,086,800)

**Step 3 ‚Äì Divide by 2.045 to get Year 3** 

$75,086,800 √∑ 2.045 = $36,717,262

**Step 4 ‚Äì Multiply Year 3 by 1.045 to get Year 4** 

$36,717,262 √ó 1.045 = $38,369,539

**Step 5 ‚Äì Layout all years and confirm average equals Year 1 Cap Space** 

Year 1 ‚Äì $14,104,000

Year 2 ‚Äì $14,809,200

Year 3 ‚Äì $36,717,262

Year 4 ‚Äì $38,369,539

**Total = $104,000,001**

$104,000,001 √∑ 4 = $26,000,000

### Effect on Team Salary

**Offer Sheet Not Matched**

If the Prior Team does not match the Offer Sheet, then the Offering Team will apply the average of the aggregate of each Season‚Äôs [Salary](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/) across all Years.

**Offer Sheet Matched**

If the Prior Team excercises its ROFR and matches, it depends on the Prior Team‚Äôs [Team Salary](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/teamsalary/) at the time.

If the Prior Team‚Äôs Team Salary and the average of the aggregate Salaries is _above_ the Salary Cap, then the Player‚Äôs [Salary ](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/salary/)remains the same as in the Offer Sheet.

If the Prior Team‚Äôs Team Salary and the average of the aggregate Salaries is _below_ the [Salary Cap](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/salarycap/), then the Team may elect to apply the average of the aggregate Salaries across all Years or keep it the same as the Offer Sheet.

The election must be contained within the ROFR exercise notice.

title: ROFR Notice (i.e. Matching)
content: If an Offer Sheet is signed by the RFA, then the Prior Team has the right to **Match** the Principal Terms of the Offer Sheet by timely issuing an **ROFR Notice**.

title: Deadline to Match
content:
The deadline to match the Offer Sheet depends on the time the Offer Sheet was received by the Prior Team.

If received during the [Moratorium Period](https://cbaguide.com/calendar/), the deadline is 11:59 P.M. ET on July 7th.

If received after the Moratorium Period:

1. Received _prior_ to 12:00 P.M. ET ‚Äì Due by 11:59 P.M. ET the following day;
2. Received _after_ 12:00 P.M. ET ‚Äì Due by 11:59 P.M. ET on the second day following receipt.

**‚úçÔ∏è** It would be rare a Team would sign a Player to an Offer Sheet during the Moratorium Period, as it would give the Prior Team more time to decide whether to match, while tying up their Team Salary in the Offer Sheet for a longer period while they wait to see if the Offer Sheet is matched.

title: Room Requirement
content: To match an Offer Sheet, the Prior Team can use [Room](https://cbaguide.com/definitions/#room), [Bird Rights](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/salarycap/#bird) or the [Minimum Exception](https://cbaguide.com/thresholds/salarycap/#minimum) provided the amount is sufficient to cover Salary plus [Unlikely Bonuses](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/terms/compensation/incentivecompensation/#performance).

title: Effect if Offer Sheet is Matched
content:
### Player Contract Signed

The Player and Prior Team will have entered into a Contract containing all Principal Terms (but not any Non-Principal Terms) in the Offer Sheet.

The Contract may not be amended in any manner for a period of one Year.

### Restriction on Trade and Sign-and-Trade

The Prior Team cannot Trade a Player for one Year after matching the Offer Sheet without the Player‚Äôs consent, and can not trade the Player to the Offering Team for 1 Year, even if consent were provided.

The Prior Team cannot exercise the ROFR Notice as part of a [Sign-and-Trade](https://cbaguide.com/transactions/trades/signandtrade/).

**üèÄ** **Phoenix Matches Offer Sheet for Ayton**  
In the 2022 offseason, Ayton signed a 4-year, $132 million Offer Sheet with the Indiana Pacers. The Suns were required to match the Offer Sheet in order to keep Ayton, which they did. Ayton was then committed to Phoenix pursuant to a 4-year, $132 million Contract and had an implied no trade clause for the Season (and could not be traded to Indiana regardless of consent).

title: Effect of Not Matching
content:
The Player and Offering Team are deemed to have entered into a Contract when the deadline for the Prior Team to match passes, or notice is provided the Prior Team is not going to match.

The Contract will be for all of the terms and conditions contained in the [UPC](https://cbaguide.com/contractanatomy/upc/) attached to the Offer Sheet (including the physical exam contingency), and shall not be amended in any manner for one Year.

title: Relinquishing Matching Rights
content:
The Prior Team can relinquish its Matching rights at any time _except for_ when it cannot withdraw its QO without the Player‚Äôs consent (discussed above).

If Matching rights are relinquished, then the Team‚Äôs ROFR/Bird Rights to the Player are considerd Renounced, and the Player becomes a UFA.

title: Physical Exams During RFA Process
content: All three stages of the RFA process (QO, Offer Sheet, ROFR Notice) allow a physical exam contingency, but it gets tricky because a failed physical can take place after a Team‚Äôs rights have expired or been terminated. As a result, the rules below were put in place.

title: Qualifying Offer and Exams
content: If the Player fails the physical exam, then the Prior Team can withdraw the QO and it will be null and void.

title: Offer Sheet and Exams
content:
### Timeline of Physical in Offer Sheet

Must be conducted within 2 days of signing.

The Prior Team must notify of failure within 3 days, otherwise Player is deemed to have passed.

The Offer Sheet will be null and void if the physical is failed.

### Matching Rights after Offer Sheet Voided

If the Offer Sheet is null and void because of the physical exam, the Prior‚Äôs Team‚Äôs rights depend on the status of its Matching rights:

If the Matching rights had already been termined for any reason, then the Prior Team can:

1. Reinstate its Matching rights (provided the Prior Team still has the Room); or
2. Decline its Matching rights allowing the Player to become a UFA.

If Matching rights have not yet terminated, the Prior Team can still match the Offer Sheet as if it‚Äôs in place, or take one of the two options above.

The Prior Team has 2 days to make its decision.

title: Exams After ROFR Notice (Matching)
Failure to Sign Anything during RFA Process
content:
If an RFA fails to sign the QO by the applicable deadline and an Offer Sheet by March 1st, then the Prior Team will continue to hold Matching rights over the Player for the next Season.

The Prior Team must then make another QO by June 29th of next Season to retain Matching rights for the Player, and the QO terms will be the same as the previous Season.

The same rules will apply each Season that the Player does not sign.

title: No Public Statements/Enticements
content:
The Prior Team can‚Äôt make any public statement saying that they would match any Offer Sheet made.

No Team can offer consideration to another to submit or not submit an Offer Sheet or ROFR Notice.

title: Medical Disability
content: If the Player knows he‚Äôll have a medical disability prohibiting him from performing during the season of the QO, then he cannot sign the QO without the Team‚Äôs consent, and the Team will continue their Matching rights over him through the following season.

title: Arbitration of Disputes
content:
The [System Arbitrator](https://cbaguide.com/governance/arbitration/) resolves all disputes that arise relating to the RFA process.

The dispute is submitted to the Arbitrator and resolved within 5 days.

title: Copies and Notice Requirements
content:
Below are the requirements to deliver all copies of the documents to the necessary parties:

1. Offer Sheet ‚Äì Offering Team/Player gives to Prior Team. Prior Team gives to the League (same day). The League gives to the NBPA (promptly).
2. ROFR Notice ‚Äì Prior Team gives Notice to the Player. Prior Team gives Notice to the Offering Team (same day). Offering Team gives Notice to the League (promptly). League gives Notice to the NBPA (promptly).

The specific notice requirements are located at Art. XI(5)(t)-(u), p. 332.

Draft Picks Signings

title: The Process
content:
Three pages in this Guide discuss a Player‚Äôs entry into the NBA:

1. [Eligibility](https://cbaguide.com/eligibility/playereligibility/) ‚Äì Discusses when/how a Player is eligible for the NBA, at which point he enters into the Draft Process in the year he is eligible.
